channel.title: "Is X worth buying?"
channel.description:
Basically, ask and answer how good pretty much anything is. I don't really trust reviews and I want to see what do you think about the items.
I'll start this off by asking if Zeno Clash or Bit.trip beat are worth getting.

item.title: "Is X worth buying?"
item.dc:creator: Collision
item.description:
Get a 280 then.

If you can afford it, get the XFX OC’d version.

Read full topic

The latter caused me to die multiple times, but it’s a sure way to get you skills up in seemless running.

or 2 280’s.

Also, am I the only one here who actually enjoyed Mirror’s Edge thoroughly?

I thought it was an ace game, good story, good voice acting, incredicble engine, great gfx and very well designed gameplay.

item.title: "Is X worth buying?"
item.dc:creator: bob
item.description:
λdam:

What’s the greatest physics/sandbox game?
AND IS IT WORTH ANYTHING AT ALL?

This physics/sandbox game is completely free and every new version of it that comes out on the Internet will be free. It is a HL1 sandbox mod called Sandpit.

https://www.moddb.com/mods/sandpit

P.S. I would have said Garry’s Mod but I have not played it yet on my other HP laptop which runs Windows XP. Besides that, the latest version of Garry’s Mod is $10 and Sandpit is worth NOTHING at all. It is free.

Read full topic

item.title: "Is X worth buying?"
item.dc:creator: geekofalltrades
item.description:
Lamsey:

Mass Effect. Best game ever.

edit: that’s hyperbole, actually. But it’s pretty damn good. Maybe best RPG ever.

Spidey300:

Like Lamsey said, Mass Effect is one of the best RPGs ever and is certainly gonna last longer than Dead Space. But i loved Dead Space too. If you like Rpgs more, get Mass Effect and if you don’t wanna be able to sleep at night, get Dead Space.

And if possible, get both.

Oh good, I’ve been wondering about that game. It’s dirt cheap on Steam too, something like $10-$15

Well, okay, $20, but that’s still cheap as games go.

Read full topic

item.title: "Is X worth buying?"
item.dc:creator: Patonki
item.description:
Mirror’s Edge is a 2 hour long tech demo and WAW is MORE WWII. So I have to say FEAR 2 sucks the least. I still don’t like it.

Read full topic

item.title: "Is X worth buying?"
item.dc:creator: Spidey300
item.description:
Alright, i have to choose between Mirror’s Edge, FEAR 2 and COD5:WAW. So i want to know from those who’ve played them, which one is better? I searching for in terms of Longevity, Replay value and finally, more awesomeness!

I love FPS, doesn’t matter whether its shooter or platformer.

Read full topic

item.title: "Is X worth buying?"
item.dc:creator: John_Killer118
item.description:
Ramirezoid:

F.E.A.R.

Don’t buy the console version. It’s buggy and ugly as sin, but on the PC it’s fantastic.

Is LEGO Indiana Jones/Batman as good as LEGO Star Wars?

For Lego Indy: If you’ve seen the movies, you’ll have a blast with a friend who like cutscenes, Don’t buy it though.
As for Lego Batman… never played it.

Read full topic

item.title: "Is X worth buying?"
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
Mass Effect is undoubtedly a fantastic game. Best RPG ever? Not really.

It recycles a lot of shit and the only cool characters don’t want anything to do with you after about 10 hours in.

Exploring the planets is cool, though.

Read full topic

item.title: "Is X worth buying?"
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
megiddo:

Analong synthesizers are good helps to make beats on the spot, but i usually go with a digital synth hooked up to some speakers and a laptop, Korg Electribe is the best digital synth i’ve played with.

I have an old electribe-A The sound quality probably isn’t the greatest but it is certainly an entertaining piece of hardware, and I get a lot of enjoyment out of it.

item.title: "Is X worth buying?"
item.dc:creator: Siggs
item.description:
Personally, FEAR is one of very few games I play online, the other 2 being TF2 and a little COD4.

Personally, I love it online because there’s a decent level of mayhem, and despite being horribly angular, the maps are pretty good. Recently I swiched to the free multiplayer segment, FEAR Combat, so if your not willing to pay, give that a go, it’s not cut down in any way.
.

Read full topic

item.title: "Is X worth buying?"
item.dc:creator: Repzik
item.description:
Ramirezoid:

F.E.A.R.

Don’t buy the console version. It’s buggy and ugly as sin, but on the PC it’s fantastic.

I wouldn’t buy it. Borrowing it from someone else is probably the best way to go, because you may end up like me (I borrowed it and I immediately uninstalled after completion). It’s just not that fun.

Read full topic
